rukus.text: O you (who are) covered with cloth
Rise, then warn
and then (declare) the greatness of your Fosterer
and then keep your clothes clean
and then forsake uncleanliness
and do not bestow favour (with the intention of) receiving more (in return)
and then be patient for (the sake of) your Fosterer
So (the day) when the trumpet will be sounded
then that day will be the day of difficulty
it will not be easy for the infidels
Leave Me and him whom I created alone
and assigned to him extensive wealth
and sons who are witnessed (being always present before him)
and made habitable for him (his) habitation
(Even) then he hopes that I would give him more
By no means ! he offers opposition to Our signs
I will involve him in a severe punishment
He reflected and made a programme
So be he killed, how he made a programme
again be he killed, how he made a programme
Then he looked
then he frowned and made a face
then he turned away considering himself great
then said, “This is nothing but magic derived from the ancient
this is nothing but the statement of man.”
I will make him enter hell
And what will make you realize what hell is
It does not let (anything) to remain nor does it spare
It will burn and darken the skin (of man)
Over it are nineteen

And We have not appointed the guardians of hell, other than the angels, and We have not fixed their number but for the affliction of those who do not believe. So that those who are given the book may be certain and those who believe may increase in belief and those who were given the book and the believers may not be doubtful. And those in whose hearts is a disease and the infidels may say, “What does Allah intend by this similitude?” Thus Allah leaves to stray whom He wills and He guides whom He wills and no one knows the forces of your Fosterer except He Himself and this is nothing but a reminder to man
